meanings.sent1: The old, torn book was unsalable at the bookstore.
meanings.sent2: The broken toy was unsalable because no one wanted to buy it.
meanings.sent3: The unsalable lemonade stand had no customers all day.
meanings.sent4: Her unsalable artwork gathered dust in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent5: The unsalable car sat in the garage for years, untouched.

meanings.sent1: The expired food was unsalable and had to be thrown away.
meanings.sent2: The damaged goods were unsalable due to their poor condition.
meanings.sent3: The unsalable clothes were turned into rags for cleaning.
meanings.sent4: The unsalable house needed extensive repairs before it could be sold.
meanings.sent5: The unsalable product was removed from the shelves to make room for new items.
